title: Case Rosse
description: Ashby describes a rich archaeological landscape that once included the remains of Roman-period tombs and villas, the latter appointed with mosaics. The modern toponym "Case Rosse" is said to derive from a well-preserved Roman tomb executed in brick that was purposefully destroyed in 1824.

properties.description: 1:150,000 scale representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 20816
